items.content:
726: :label: cor-derivatives-continuous-cinf
727: 
728: All derivatives ∇^m V_fit (m ≥ 1) are continuous functions of (x_i, S, ρ).

items.label: cor-compact-bounds-cinf
items.title: Uniform Bounds on Compact Sets
items.content:
734: :label: cor-compact-bounds-cinf
735: 
736: For any compact K ⊆ X and any ρ_min ≤ ρ ≤ ρ_max:
737: 
738: $$
739: \sup_{x_i \in K, S, \rho \in [\rho_{\min}, \rho_{\max}]} \|\nabla^m V_{\text{fit}}\| \leq C(K, \rho_{\min}, \rho_{\max}, m) < \infty
740: $$
741: 
742: k-uniform and N-uniform.

items.label: cor-instantaneous-smoothing-cinf
items.title: Instantaneous Smoothing
items.content:
886: :label: cor-instantaneous-smoothing-cinf
887: 
888: For any initial distribution μ_0 (possibly singular, e.g., δ_{w_0}), the time-evolved distribution μ_t = e^{tL} μ_0 has a C∞ density for all t > 0.
items.raw_directive:

items.label: cor-wasserstein-convergence-cinf
items.title: Exponential Convergence in Wasserstein Distance
items.content:
933: :label: cor-wasserstein-convergence-cinf
934: 
935: Under {prf:ref}`prop-talagrand-cinf` hypotheses:
936: 
937: $$
938: W_2(\mu_t, \pi_{\text{QSD}}) \leq e^{-\lambda_{\text{Tal}} t / 2} W_2(\mu_0, \pi_{\text{QSD}})
939: $$
